register.description: This register contains the IP revision code

bitfield.description: Reads returns 0
IP revision [7:4] Major revision [3:0] Minor revision Examples: 0x10 for 1.0, 0x21 for 2.1

register.description: This register controls the various parameters of the OCP interface

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility Reads return 0
Write 0 for future compatibility Reads returns 0
This bit must be kept 0 for normal functioning of the IP. Do not set this bit to 1
Internal OCP clock gating strategy

register.description: This register provides status information about the module, excluding the interrupt status information

bitfield.description: Reads returns 0
Reads returns 0 [reserved for OCP-socket status information]
Internal reset monitoring

register.description: This interrupt status register regroups all the status of the module internal events that can generate an interrupt.

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Status of the Wait3 Edge Detection interrupt
Status of the Wait2 Edge Detection interrupt
Status of the Wait1 Edge Detection interrupt
Status of the Wait0 Edge Detection interrupt
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Status of the TerminalCountEvent interrupt
Status of the FIFOEvent interrupt

register.description: The interrupt enable register allows to mask/unmask the module internal sources of interrupt, on a event-by-event basis.

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Enables the Wait3 Edge Detection interrupt
Enables the Wait2 Edge Detection interrupt
Enables the Wait1 Edge Detection interrupt
Enables the Wait0 Edge Detection interrupt
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Enables TerminalCountEvent interrupt issuing in pre-fetch or write posting mode
Enables the FIFOEvent interrupt

register.description: The GPMC_TIMEOUT_CONTROL register allows the user to set the start value of the timeout counter

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Start value of the time-out counter [0x000 corresponds to 0 GPMC.FCLK cycle, 0x001 corresponds to 1 GmpcClk cycle, &, 0x1FF corresponds to 511 GPMC.FCLK cyles.]
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Enable bit of the TimeOut feature

register.description: The GPMC_ERR_ADDRESS register stores the address of the illegal access when an error occurs

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Address of illegal access : A30[0 for memory region, 1 for GPMC register region] and A29-A0[1 GBytes maximum]

register.description: The GPMC_ERR_TYPE register stores the type of error when an error occurs

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
System Command of the transaction that caused the error
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Not supported Address error
Not supported Command error
Time-out error
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Error validity status - Must be explicitely cleared with a write 1 transaction

register.description: The configuration register allows global configuration of the GPMC

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Selects the polarity of input pin WAIT3
Selects the polarity of input pin WAIT2
Selects the polarity of input pin WAIT1
Selects the polarity of input pin WAIT0
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Controls the WP output pin level
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Limited Address device support
Enables the Force Posted Write feature to NAND Cmd/Add/Data location

register.description: The status register provides global status bits of the GPMC

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Is a copy of input pin WAIT3. [Reset value is WAIT3 input pin sampled at IC reset]
Is a copy of input pin WAIT2. [Reset value is WAIT2 input pin sampled at IC reset]
Is a copy of input pin WAIT1. [Reset value is WAIT1 input pin sampled at IC reset]
Is a copy of input pin WAIT0. [Reset value is WAIT0 input pin sampled at IC reset]
Write 0's for future compatibility Reads returns 0
Stores the empty status of the write buffer

register.description: Prefetch engine configuration 1

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0

Define the number of GPMC.FCLK cycles to be substracted from RdCycleTime, WrCycleTime, AccessTime, CSRdOffTime, CSWrOffTime, ADVRdOffTime, ADVWrOffTime, OEOffTime, WEOffTime [0x0 corresponds to 0 GPMC.FCLK cycle, 0x1 corresponds to 1 GPMC.FCLK cycle, &, 0x7 corresponds to 7 GPMC.FCLK cycles]
Enables access cycle optimization
Selects the CS where Prefetch Postwrite engine is active [0x0 corresponds toCS0, 0x1 corresponds to CS1, &, 0x7 corresponds to CS7]
Enables the PFPW RoundRobin arbitration
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0

When an arbitration occurs between a direct memory access and a PFPW engine access, the direct memory access is always serviced. If the PFPWEnRoundRobin is enabled, 0x0 means : the next access is granted to the PFPW engine, 0x1 means : the two next accesses are granted to the PFPW engine, ..., 0xF means : the 16 next accesses are granted to the PFPW engine.
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0

Selects the maximum number of bytes read from the FIFO or written to the FIFO by the host on a DMA or interrupt request [0x00 corresponds to 0 byte, 0x01 corresponds to 1 byte, &, 0x40 corresponds to 64 bytes]
Enables the Prefetch Postwite engine
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Select which wait pin edge detector should start the engine in synchronized mode
Selects when the engine starts the access to CS
Selects interrupt synchronization or DMA request synchronization
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Selects pre-fetch read or write posting accesses

register.description: Prefetch engine configuration 2

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Selects the number of bytes to be read or written by the engine to the selected CS [0x0000 corresponds to 0 byte, 0x0001 corresponds to 1 byte, &, 0x2000 corresponds to 8 Kbytes]

register.description: Prefetch engine control

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Resets the FIFO pointer and starts the engine

register.description: Prefetch engine status

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0

Number of available bytes to be read or number of free empty byte places to be written [0x00 corresponds to 0 byte available to be read or 0 free empty place to be written, &, 0x40 corresponds to 64 bytes available to be read or 64 empty places to be written]
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Set when FIFOPointer exceeds FIFOThreshold value
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0

Number of remaining bytes to be read or to be written by the engine according to the TransferCount value [0x0000 corresponds to 0 byte remaining to be read or to be written, 0x0001 corresponds to 1 byte remaining to be read or to be written, &, 0x2000 corresponds to 8 Kbytes remaining to be read or to be written]

register.description: ECC configuration

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
ECC algorithm used 0x0: Hamming code 0x1: BCH code
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Error correction capability used for BCH 0x0: up to 4 bits error correction [t = 4] 0x1: up to 8 bits error correction [t=8] 0x2: up to 16 bits error correction [t=16] 0x3: reserved
Spare area organization definition for the BCH algorithm. See the BCH syndrome/parity calculator module functional specification for more details
Selects an ECC calculated on 16 columns
Number of sectors to process with the BCH algorithm 0x0: 1 sector [512kB page] 0x1: 2 sectors ... 0x3: 4 sectors [2kB page] ... 0x7: 8 sectors [4kB page]
Selects the CS where ECC is computed
Enables the ECC feature

register.description: ECC control

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Clear all ECC result registers [Reads returns 0 - Writes 1 to this field clear all ECC result registers - Writes 0 are ignored]
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0

Selects ECC result register [Reads to this field give the dynamic position of the ECC pointer - Writes to this field select the ECC result register where the first ECC computation will be stored]; Other enums: writing other values disables the ECC engine [ECCEnable bit of GPMC_ECC_CONFIG set to 0]

register.description: ECC size

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 3
Defines ECC size 1 [0x00 corresponds to 2 Bytes, 0x01 corresponds to 4 Bytes, 0x02 corresponds to 6 Bytes, 0x03 corresponds to 8 Bytes, &, 0xFF corresponds to 512 Bytes]
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 3
Defines ECC size 0 [0x00 corresponds to 2 Bytes, 0x01 corresponds to 4 Bytes, 0x02 corresponds to 6 Bytes, 0x03 corresponds to 8 Bytes, &, 0xFF corresponds to 512 Bytes]
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Selects ECC size for ECC 9 result register
Selects ECC size for ECC 8 result register
Selects ECC size for ECC 7 result register
Selects ECC size for ECC 6 result register
Selects ECC size for ECC 5 result register
Selects ECC size for ECC 4 result register
Selects ECC size for ECC 3 result register
Selects ECC size for ECC 2 result register
Selects ECC size for ECC 1 result register

register.description: ECC result register

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Odd Row Parity bit 2048, only used for ECC computed on 512 Bytes
Odd Row Parity bit 1024
Odd Row Parity bit 512
Odd Row Parity bit 256
Odd Row Parity bit 128
Odd Row Parity bit 64
Odd Row Parity bit 32
Odd Row Parity bit 16
Odd Row Parity bit 8
Odd Column Parity bit 4
Odd Column Parity bit 2
Odd Column Parity bit 1
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Even Row Parity bit 2048, only used for ECC computed on 512 Bytes
Even Row Parity bit 1024
Even Row Parity bit 512
Even Row Parity bit 256
Even Row Parity bit 128
Even Row Parity bit 64
Even Row Parity bit 32
Even Row Parity bit 16
Even Row Parity bit 8
Even Column Parity bit 4
Even Column Parity bit 2
Even Column Parity bit 1

register.description: This register is used to directly pass data to the BCH ECC calculator without accessing the actual NAND flash interface.

bitfield.description: Data to be included in the BCH calculation. Only bits 0 to 7 are taken into account if the calculator is configured to use 8 bits data [ECC16B = 0]

register.description: The configuration 1 register sets signal control parameters per chip select

bitfield.description: Enables the wrapping burst capability. Must be set if the attached device is configured in wrapping burst
Selects the read single or multiple access
Selects the read mode operation
Selects the write single or multiple access
Selects the write mode operation
Output GPMC.CLK activation time
Specifies the attached device page [burst] length
Selects the Wait monitoring configuration for Read accesses [Reset value is BOOTWAITEN input pin sampled at IC reset]
Selects the Wait monitoring configuration for Write accesses
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Selects input pin Wait monitoring time
Selects the input WAIT pin for this chip select [Reset value is BOOTWAITSELECT input pin sampled at IC reset for CS0 and 0 for CS1-7]
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Selects the device size attached [Reset value is BOOTDEVICESIZE input pin sampled at IC reset for CS0 and 01 for CS1-7]
Selects the attached device type
Enables the Address and data multiplexed protocol [Reset value is CS0MUXDEVICE input pin sampled at IC reset for CS0 and 0 for CS1-7]
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0

Signals timing latencies scalar factor [Rd/WRCycleTime, AccessTime, PageBurstAccessTime, CSOnTime, CSRd/WrOffTime, ADVOnTime, ADVRd/WrOffTime, OEOnTime, OEOffTime, WEOnTime, WEOffTime, Cycle2CycleDelay, BusTurnAround, TimeOutStartValue]
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Divides the GPMC.FCLK clock

register.description: Chip-select signal timing parameter configuration

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility Reads returns 0
CS# de-assertion time from start cycle time for write accesses [0x00 corresponds to 0 GPMC.FCLK cycle, 0x01 corresponds to 1 GPMC.FCLK cycle, &, 0x1F corresponds to 31 GPMC.FCLK cycles]
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
CS# de-assertion time from start cycle time for read accesses [0x00 corresponds to 0 GPMC.FCLK cycle, 0x01 corresponds to 1 GPMC.FCLK cycle, &, 0x1F corresponds to 31 GPMC.FCLK cycles]
CS# Add Extra Half GPMC.FCLK cycle
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
CS# assertion time from start cycle time [0x0 corresponds to 0 GPMC.FCLK cycle, 0x1 corresponds to 1 GPMC.FCLK cycle, &, 0xF corresponds to 15 GPMC.FCLK cycles]

register.description: ADV# signal timing parameter configuration

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
ADV# de-assertion for first address phase when using the AAD-Mux protocol
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
ADV# assertion for first address phase when using the AAD-Mux protocol
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
ADV# de-assertion time from start cycle time for write accesses [0x00 corresponds to 0 GPMC.FCLK cycle, 0x01 corresponds to 1 GPMC.FCLK cycle, &, 0x1F corresponds to 31 GPMC.FCLK cycles]
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
ADV# de-assertion time from start cycle time for read accesses[0x00 corresponds to 0 GPMC.FCLK cycle, 0x01 corresponds to 1 GPMC.FCLK cycle, &, 0x1F corresponds to 31 GPMC.FCLK cycles]
ADV# Add Extra Half GPMC.FCLK cycle
ADV# assertion for first address phase when using the AAD-Mux protocol
ADV# assertion time from start cycle time [0x0 corresponds to 0 GPMC.FCLK cycle, 0x1 corresponds to 1 GPMC.FCLK cycle, &, 0xF corresponds to 15 GPMC.FCLK cycles]

register.description: WE# and OE# signals timing parameter configuration

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
WE# de-assertion time from start cycle time [0x00 corresponds to 0 GPMC.FCLK cycle, 0x01 corresponds to 1 GPMC.FCLK cycle, &, 0x1F corresponds to 31 GPMC.FCLK cycles]
WE# Add Extra Half GPMC.FCLK cycle
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
WE# assertion time from start cycle time [0x0 corresponds to 0 GPMC.FCLK cycle, 0x1 corresponds to 1 GPMC.FCLK cycle, &, 0xF corresponds to 15 GPMC.FCLK cycles]
OE# de-assertion time for the first address phase in an AAD-Mux access
OE# de-assertion time from start cycle time [0x00 corresponds to 0 GPMC.FCLK cycle, 0x01 corresponds to 1 GPMC.FCLK cycle, &, 0x1F corresponds to 31 GPMC.FCLK cycles]
OE# Add Extra Half GPMC.FCLK cycle
OE# assertion time for the first address phase in an AAD-Mux access
OE# assertion time from start cycle time [0x0 corresponds to 0 GPMC.FCLK cycle, 0x1 corresponds to 1 GPMC.FCLK cycle, &, 0xF corresponds to 15 GPMC.FCLK cycles]

register.description: RdAccessTime and CycleTime timing parameters configuration

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Delay between successive words in a multiple access [0x0 corresponds to 0 GPMC.FCLK cycle, 0x1 corresponds to 1 GPMC.FCLK cycle, &, 0xF corresponds to 15 GPMC.FCLK cycles]
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Delay between start cycle time and first data valid [0x00 corresponds to 0 GPMC.FCLK cycle, 0x01 corresponds to 1 GPMC.FCLK cycle, &, 0x1F corresponds to 31 GPMC.FCLK cycles]
Write 0's for future compatibility Reads returns 0
Total write cycle time [0x00 corresponds to 0 GPMC.FCLK cycle, 0x01 corresponds to 1 GPMC.FCLK cycle, &, 0x1F corresponds to 31 GPMC.FCLK cycles]
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Total read cycle time [0x00 corresponds to 0 GPMC.FCLK cycle, 0x01 corresponds to 1 GPMC.FCLK cycle, &, 0x1F corresponds to 31 GPMC.FCLK cycles]

register.description: WrAccessTime, WrDataOnADmuxBus, Cycle2Cycle and BusTurnAround parameters configuration

bitfield.description: TI Internal use - Do not modify
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0

Delay from StartAccessTime to the GPMC.FCLK rising edge corresponding the the GPMC.CLK rising edge used by the attached memory for the first data capture [0x00 corresponds to 0 GPMC.FCLK cycle, 0x01 corresponds to 1 GPMC.FCLK cycle, &, 0x1F corresponds to 31 GPMC.FCLK cycles]
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Specifies on which GPMC.FCLK rising edge the first data of the synchronous burst write is driven in the add/data mux bus
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Chip select high pulse delay between two successive accesses [0x0 corresponds to 0 GPMC.FCLK cycle, 0x1 corresponds to 1 GPMC.FCLK cycle, &, 0xF corresponds to 15 GPMC.FCLK cycles]
Add Cycle2CycleDelay between two successive accesses to the same chip-select [any access type]
Add Cycle2CycleDelay between two successive accesses to a different chip-select [any access type]
Write 0's for future compatibility Reads returns 0

Bus turn around latency between two successive accesses to the same chip-select [rd to wr] or to a different chip-select [read to read and read to write] [0x0 corresponds to 0 GPMC.FCLK cycle, 0x1 corresponds to 1 GPMC.FCLK cycle, &, 0xF corresponds to 15 GPMC.FCLK cycles]

register.description:
Chip-select address mapping configuration
Note: For CS0, the register reset is 0xf40 while for all the other instances CS1-CS7, the reset is 0xf00.

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Chip-select mask address
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Chip-select enable [reset value is 1 for CS0 and 0 for CS1-7]
Chip-select base address

register.description: This Register is not a true register, just a address location.
This Register is not a true register, just a address location.
This Register is not a true register, just a address location.
BCH ECC result, bits 0 to 31

bitfield.description: BCH ECC result, bits 32 to 63
